main_definition: Webcams are digital video cameras that can stream live footage over the internet, often used for remote monitoring or personal communication.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A device used to record videos online in real-time
meanings_and_examples.example: Sarah set up her webcam and began streaming a live cooking tutorial.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A video conferencing tool that allows people to see each other and communicate remotely
meanings_and_examples.example: The family used their webcams during the virtual reunion, chatting while seeing themselves on the screen.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A surveillance system component that provides remote monitoring capabilities
meanings_and_examples.example: The security company installed webcams to monitor the property from a central control room.
